column4: can anyone help me with this problem http://askubuntu.com/questions/120640/unity-toolbar-icons-disappear-on-boot
my toolbar icons disappear on boot
seen a few folks mention that re-installing can solve that - haven't experienced it myself
'$ sudo apt-get purge unity', restart and login to the classic environment and '$ sudo apt-get install unity'
who knows what that will do
I told you already, that'd re-install unity
I know that would reinstall unity .. but I don't want to reinstall that might screw something up.. I'd rather fix the issue if possible.
how can you "screw up" something that's already screwed up?
i dont have time to reinstall my whole OS and all apps if reinstalling blows up my system
re-installing a desktop environment won't break your system - it's just the environment ...
logged out and logged into unity 2D then logged out and logged into unity and still no toolbar icons
